Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Throughout the text, there are multiple examples of sustainable or environmental practices that have been implemented. Some of them include:

1. Using recycled materials (e.g., tires) for insulation and flooring.
2. Powering the buildings through solar and wind energy.
3. Building homes "off the grid," meaning they are not connected to public utilities.
4. Designing homes for energy efficiency, resulting in reduced energy consumption and costs.
5. Prioritizing healthier indoor air quality through energy-efficient designs and green building techniques.
6. Focusing on regenerative development, which helps transform the housing market into a more sustainable and resilient one.
7. Utilizing green building certifications, such as LEED Platinum, to ensure high standards of environmental performance.

source.content: Climate change is on everyone’s mind right now Many people want to lessen their impact on the environment whether that entails installing solar panels cycling instead of driving or eating less meat Other people pursue a more radical dream – literally living “outside the box” and off the grid I had the chance to experience an eco-friendly “earthship” first hand and it was amazing When I traveled to Jefferson Colorado to visit one of my best friends from college I had no idea my real estate and cardiovascular horizons would be so expanded My friend Kristin lives in an earthship that she and her family built with their own hands – completely off the grid One side of the house is insulated by 1 recycled tires The other side has an expansive  degree view of the beautiful high desert The floor is “polished mud” The walls are adobe mud The house is powered by solar and wind The construction is solid the views are breathtaking and the home is beautiful cozy and livable – no one’s roughing it

deliberately started to combat climate change and resource scarcity via in-city homebuilding Based in Portland and Seattle the company’s mission is to build homes relationships and businesses that help regenerate communities and environments Backed by over 70 impact investors Green Canopy has successfully sold over  third party certified deep green Net Zero energy healthy homes in the Pacific Northwest since  Meeting the challenge of global warming and the housing crisis requires disruptive integrated and inclusive solutions Green Canopy is a fully integrated development firm including Net Zero energy residential development general contracting and fund management Green Canopy’s goal in building all-electric healthy homes is to help spark a transformation toward a more sustainable and resilient housing market” As the daughter of a sustainable contractor raised here in Portland’s environment of ecological focus it has been personally meaningful to have a transaction with such

Energy efficient home design and green building techniques do more than just reduce the impacts on our climate and limited natural resources They provide a quieter more comfortable and healthy indoor environment that is also more durable and longer lasting than conventional homes A more efficient home is also less expensive to operate and will lower your monthly bills Homes with these features are likely to see higher resale values providing for a solid return on investment See the graphic below for a nice summary of estimated paybacks of various home efficiency upgrades and visit Earth Advantage and Energy Trust of Oregon for much more useful information I’ve had a lifelong passion for helping improve our natural world and have dedicated my career to that purpose Earlier this year I became an accredited Earth Advantage Broker and by doing so have committed to staying current on and communicating the value and benefits of high performance homes and efficient building design At the age

Sometime in the late aughts a pocket of the Cully neighborhood in Northeast Portland became the grounds for a mini hyperlocal eco-renaissance led by a group of like-minded neighbors “We often call it an accidental intentional community” said one resident Dubbing themselves the Ainsworth Collective and spread over the blocks near the intersection of NE Ainsworth and 45th Avenue this unofficial group would meet monthly in support of living more mindfully with the environment As such several members bought land and built pioneering eco-homes that pushed the green technology of the day seven of which were profiled by us in  One of those houses designed by DeBar Architecture and built by W A Hughes Construction in  is LEED-Certified Platinum and now for sale It might draw on the past for its traditional gabled form but everything else about it from the rooftop solar panels to the earthen floor in the living room are forward-thinking and aimed at reducing environmental impact Listing

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are multiple events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events might not be feasible due to character limitations. Some notable examples include:

1. Earth Day Oregon (April)
2. Sustainable Oregon (September)
3. Climate Reality Leadership Training (various dates)
4. Oregon Environmental Council's Annual Dinner & Auction (October)
5. Willamette Riverkeeper's Annual River Hero Awards (November)
6. Oregon Wild's Annual Conservation Dinner (December)

These events represent a diverse range of organizations and initiatives dedicated to promoting environmental conservation in Oregon.

Join the Bridge to Portland Group on April 22 from 10 am – 12 pm at our Living Room Realty Multnomah Village office at  SW 35th Ave This event is part of the Multnomah Village Earth Day Celebration featuring special Earth Day activities kids’ events music and community cleanup Stop by to shred some of those post-tax day documents enjoy a beverage from Case Study Coffee on us and check out all the Earth Day festivities in the Village This event is in support of the Neighborhood House Food Pantry the largest food pantry program on Portland’s west side serving over 2 individuals each month They also just so happen to be our next-door neighbors We are collecting food donations during the event and everyone who brings a donation will receive an extra entry in our giveaway for a 25 gift card to Annie Bloom’s Books A big shout out to our incredible event partners at OnPoint Community Credit Union Trevor Reink  Melody Woodland As local loan officers with several years of experience behind them

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: As per my knowledge cutoff date in September 2023, the Home Energy Score program in Portland primarily focuses on providing information related to energy costs and offering cost-effective energy efficiency improvements. However, there could be other initiatives within the city aimed at measuring broader environmental impact metrics. To find specific details regarding these metrics, I would recommend checking the official website of the City of Portland or contacting them directly for updated information.

source.content: Earth Advantage just posted an update with some stats after the first month and a half of requiring all newly listed homes to have an energy assessment scoring test and share the results with potential buyers Explanation Sellers are required to include the Home Energy Score and report in a listing or public posting so that buyers can access the information when they’re shopping for a home While the City of Portland has not specified RMLS as the location to publicize the score RMLS has provided the real estate industry with a simple process to auto-populate the score and the URL link of the report straight into the home listing This one-click process makes using the RMLS listing the easiest place for seller’s representatives to meet the city requirement A tutorial on this RMLS service can be found here Reminder Home sellers who do not comply with the ordinance may be assessed civil penalties of up to  initially and another  for every subsequent -day period during which the violation

cost-effective energy efficiency improvements Reminder Real estate professionals can help manage client expectations by making sure they are aware of the average score in Portland and remind them that scores at the higher end of the  range represent very energy efficient homes Answer The City of Portland Home Energy Score program does review the work of the authorized Home Energy Assessors This occurs in three ways Explanation If a score or information contained on the Home Energy Report appears inaccurate first follow-up directly with the Home Energy Assessor The assessor will be able to provide more information about how a score is calculated and an explanation of home features that went into creating the score They will also be able to make corrections to the score and/or the report if any errors are identified Assessors are also required to relay disputes to the quality assurance team if they occur The quality assurance team will then work directly with the assessor to review the

When a home goes on the market in the city of Portland an HES or Home Energy Score must be listed as well So for sellers that is the first thing they can do to get their house ready to list What is the HES Ultimately the HES offers information about the energy costs of a house We like to think about it as the house’s “gas mileage” The HES gives buyers a more holistic sense of a home’s monthly bottom line The accompanying report will offer ways to make improvements if a house doesn’t score a perfect 10 The most common score we see is a 4 and when you complete a purchase you can make energy improvements to your new home About Us Over the course of their professional partnership Aryne + Dulcinea have helped over  clients prosper in their new lives During this time they have prided themselves in their top-notch selling abilities with homes outperforming market standards consistently exceeding list price while most of their listings sell in under 7 days Whether you’re looking to buy or sell

If you’ve bought or sold a home in the last year or two in the city of Portland or if you’ve just cruised real estate listings online for fun I know—I do it too you have probably noticed “HES” accompanied by a number in the home descriptions “HES” stands for “Home Energy Score” Beginning in  in Portland sellers of single-family homes are required to obtain and disclose a Home Energy Report  What information is included in a Home Energy Report This report provides valuable estimates of a home’s energy use and costs and provides cost-effective solutions that improve a home’s efficiency And what is the point of this you might ask In practical terms it helps future homeowners to avoid surprises like outrageous heating bills the first winter More broadly it encourages homeowners to maintain an energy-efficient home—and our collective efforts can have a large positive environmental impact click here for more information on how maintain an energy efficient home If you’re buying or selling a

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, Living Room Realty has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. Firstly, they are a certified B Corp, which means they meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. This demonstrates their dedication to using business as a force for good. Secondly, they donate 5% of their annual profit to local charities, showing their commitment to giving back to the community. Additionally, they have partnered with various organizations like African American Alliance for Homeownership, Hoffman Center for the Arts, Rose Haven, and Taking Ownership PDX, among others. These partnerships showcase their dedication to supporting diverse causes and initiatives within their community. Lastly, they encourage excellence across all aspects of their business operations, ensuring that they consistently strive for high quality and positive impact.

source.content: 21 were also updated to reflect the ADU SDC Waiver Program The Revenue Division will be responsible for administering the restrictive covenant and enforcing violations There is a  application fee for the ADU SDC waiver which will help fund a position in the Revenue Division to oversee the program and administer covenants The Revenue Division will also collect annual data about rents charged for ADUs that receive SDC waivers to report to City Council every two years In  the year before SDC fees were waived 24 permits for new ADUs were issued – both newly constructed and conversions of existing living space In   ADU permits were issued amounting about 10 percent of permits for new dwelling units that year Additionally due to the need to complete and record the restrictive covenant it will be less likely that permits for ADUs can be approved over the counter in the Development Services Center If you would like genuine focused and sincere representation in the sale or purchase of your

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are several products, services, and technologies mentioned throughout the passage. Some notable examples include:

1. Power-sprayer: A tool used for cleaning surfaces by spraying water or other solutions. It allows users to reach hard-to-clean areas easily.
2. Smart Home systems: These are advanced home automation technologies that allow users to remotely operate various aspects of their homes, such as locking doors, adjusting temperature, controlling lighting, and monitoring security.
3. Sphere: A mobile-optimized real estate business management platform designed to help manage tasks, track progress, and stay organized.
4. Millwork and shiplap: These materials are used for decorative elements in interior design, adding character and visual interest to spaces.
5. Local artisan and vintage pendants: These refer to unique and stylish lighting fixtures sourced from local artists or vintage items, often adding a personalized touch to a room.
6. Smart lighting technology: Advanced lighting systems that allow users to customize their lighting experiences based on time of day, activity, and mood.
7. Wide and long wood planks: Thicker and longer wooden boards used for flooring or other applications, providing a rustic and substantial look.
8. Voice activation systems (like Google Home and Amazon Alexa): These devices enable users to control various smart home features and devices with simple voice commands.

source.content: remote are now able to be operated from the internet Need to go out of town but your cousin is finally able to return the power-sprayer he borrowed two weeks ago “Leave it in the garage Cousin Larry” The best part is feeling lighter in the pockets from needing to carry fewer keys Keep the batteries charged and you can check that the door is locked from the comfort of your toasty bed Smart Home concerns we’ve encountered mostly come from needing to have confidential conversations in homes where audio/video recording is present or the times when early iterations weren’t as user friendly doors being difficult to open because of access codes being wrong or needing the enter key pressed before and after the code Overall we’re enjoying the new possibilities of time saved security provided and mood selected At the age of 48 there are a couple of things that I’m proficient or good This past month I got to be the client I couldn’t be more thrilled to move In a move that has both impressed and

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
The key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce involve different stakeholders such as businesses, consumers, government agencies, nonprofit organizations, and technology companies. These partnerships aim to create a seamless and efficient shopping experience for customers while supporting local economies and promoting sustainable practices. Some examples include:

1. Business associations: Collaboration between businesses within an industry or geographical area can lead to joint marketing campaigns, shared resources, and advocacy for policy changes that benefit the entire group.
2. Supplier relationships: Companies often partner with suppliers to ensure a steady flow of quality products and materials, which helps maintain production levels and keep costs under control.
3. Retailer partnerships: Retailers may form strategic alliances with other retailers, wholesalers, or manufacturers to increase purchasing power, share distribution channels, or co-create exclusive products and experiences for customers.
4. Payment processors and financial institutions: Partnerships between payment processors (like Visa, Mastercard, and PayPal) and banks facilitate secure transactions and provide access to funding sources for both merchants and consumers.
5. Government agencies and economic development organizations: Governments and nonprofits work together to promote local commerce, attract businesses, and support small business growth through grants, tax incentives, and infrastructure improvements.
6. Nonprofit organizations and corporate sponsors: Collaborative initiatives between nonprofits and for-profit companies can result in mutually beneficial partnerships that address social and environmental issues while also promoting brand awareness and customer loyalty.
7. Technology companies and retailers: Partnerships between tech firms and brick-and-mortar stores or online retailers can lead to innovative solutions like augmented reality dressing rooms, AI-powered chatbots, and personalized marketing campaigns.

source.content: Forbescom contributor Dinah Wisenberg Brin recently asked entrepreneurs to share their best business investments from the past year and I was happy to share our two biggest investments at Living Room Realty Staff are Living Room’s biggest asset and investing in training and development of our staff We invest in our people by sending them to executive trainings and paying for membership to peer-to-peer organizations that support executives’ personal and professional development We set aside five percent of our budget each year for trainings and consultants for our employees Employees have an education credit that renews each year We don’t say ‘no’ to any request for learning because we feel if our employees are able to pursue their passions and what brings them joy they are more likely to be productive and stay with a company that supports them as whole beings We spend a lot of time reminding staff that they have this credit and encourage them to use it We also invest in creating fun

Forbescom contributor Dinah Wisenberg Brin recently asked entrepreneurs to share their best business investments from the past year and I was happy to share our two biggest investments at Living Room Realty Staff are Living Room’s biggest asset and investing in training and development of our staff We invest in our people by sending them to executive trainings and paying for membership to peer-to-peer organizations that support executives’ personal and professional development We set aside five percent of our budget each year for trainings and consultants for our employees Employees have an education credit that renews each year We don’t say ‘no’ to any request for learning because we feel if our employees are able to pursue their passions and what brings them joy they are more likely to be productive and stay with a company that supports them as whole beings We spend a lot of time reminding staff that they have this credit and encourage them to use it We also invest in creating fun

ups-and-downs this month with successful closings but also terminated transactions All of them though have kept their positive energy alive and maintained a healthy dose of perspective And ultimately that’s what really matters in this business Perspective Kindness Balance Empathy And some damn good celebrating once it all comes together Here’s to all the hard-working buyers out there…your key day is coming At the age of 48 there are a couple of things that I’m proficient or good This past month I got to be the client I couldn’t be more thrilled to move In a move that has both impressed and bewildered local educators Steve Brian a neighborhood dad While there is much to be celebrated within the queer community there is also much to We love to talk share and be friendly Connect with us on social media

social distancing and I saw lots of folks shaking hands etc In retrospect perhaps I hadn’t gotten the message either by virtue of that fact that I was at the beach to surf In the public sphere these days it appears that everyone is doing a really good job of following the rules From that week up until about a week ago the situation in the real estate market was very fluid My opinions on what was happening and how to advise on any particular situation was evolving almost hourly Rules were changing operations were closing down and sometime opening back up…we all really had no idea where things were heading Sitting here today Thursday April 16  I feel like we as a company and as an industry have a pretty good handle on where the market stands Below are a couple of discussion topics If you have any questions or want a further explanation please don’t hesitate to reach out to me Sometime in late March the state of Washington suspended Real Estate services as a part of their total state

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific publication, research finding, or introduced technology mentioned. However, some general trends have been discussed, such as the increasing popularity of smart home technology, the rise of quartz as a preferred countertop material, and the decline of white subway tile in backsplash designs. Additionally, there has been a growing interest in larger lots and multi-purpose living spaces.

source.content: and textures brought in through millwork and shiplap Lighting will take center stage with distinctive fixtures including local artisan and vintage pendants or an old gas signage and chandeliers And smart lighting technology will enable homeowners to customize their lighting experience based on time of day activity and mood Hardwood floors will continue to dominate the market The trend is toward either very dark stains paired with light-colored walls or light stains with darker walls Greyish tones will remain popular as will matte finishes which are easier to maintain than high gloss Expect to see frequent use of wider and longer wood planks as well as distressed and wire-brushed finishes which add texture and dimension Everything is getting “smarter” in homes from locks and lights to thermostats and appliances And with devices like Google Home and Amazon Alexa you can control many of these with voice activation from a central hub We will see continued integration of and advancements

reigned as the top countertop choice for many years but quartz is now king It’s highly durable low-maintenance and comes in a wide variety of styles and colors It’s also heat resistant scratch resistant and non-porous unlike granite and marble so it doesn’t need to be sealed After years of dominating backsplash design the white subway tile is officially on its way out Expect to see it replaced with more elaborate shapes patterns colors and textures Tile that mimics the appearance of wood concrete and wallpaper is also gaining in popularity While stainless steel and white porcelain are always safe bets the trend is moving toward sinks that make more of a statement Look for unexpected pops of color and materials like natural stone and copper Touch-free faucets are expected to gain favor with homeowners this year too Brass fixtures came back in a big way over the past couple of years and will continue to be a popular choice in  along with matte black black nickel polished chrome and

and appliances And with devices like Google Home and Amazon Alexa you can control many of these with voice activation from a central hub We will see continued integration of and advancements in smart-home technology in  While white kitchens will remain popular in  expect to see more color this year in everything from cabinets to tile to appliances Two-toned cabinets are quickly overtaking the white-on-white look that has dominated kitchen design for the past few years While white remains a classic grey and bleached-wood cabinet variations are surging in popularity along with darker neutrals like navy and green While getting a cabinet installed for your kitchen make sure you call the right people for the task You can view this source to find the contacts of the right professionals Granite reigned as the top countertop choice for many years but quartz is now king It’s highly durable low-maintenance and comes in a wide variety of styles and colors It’s also heat resistant scratch

OK we learned a lot about what we need to expect from “home” in the past year It’s been working overtime serving multiple roles sanctuary schoolhouse meeting room gym restaurant playground and more I’ve seen a big spike in buyers looking to find homes with more land outside the city and multipurpose layouts to accommodate space needed for families with littles I thought this list of projected trends in  from the National Association of Realtors was also interesting I’d love to hear from you on what you’re looking to find want to design/remodel or simply dream about  Till then high fives When it comes to the home and design trends experts anticipate prevailing in the year ahead the overarching theme will be options in abundance While homeowners continue to want their outdoor spaces that offer a safe retreat that appeal has shifted into other parts of the home coupling comfort with function In other words homeowners want amenities for work and leisure and they plan to enjoy long them

end up we never know Invention is pure creation — it’s pulling a thread out of the ether But innovation is taking that existing thread and re-weaving it into something entirely new Innovation is the evolution of invention It’s seeing that potential exists out there but maybe we don’t exactly know how to get to it It’s the process that grinds down the burrs and polishes up the finish of an idea The process is often more lasting than the product You can only age a spirit for so long but the distillation process has been aging with our species for centuries now Try out the products of innovation yourself at Stone Barn Brandyworks and discover refinement in the truest sense At the age of 48 there are a couple of things that I’m proficient or good This past month I got to be the client I couldn’t be more thrilled to move In a move that has both impressed and bewildered local educators Steve Brian a neighborhood dad While there is much to be celebrated within the queer community there is

source.content: above awards and certifications As a company Living Room donates 5 of our annual profit to local charities Every fall we rally our community and collect coat donations to support local charity Impact Northwest We’ve donated over  coats since this program began Through our Loving Room Fund our agents have donated thousands of dollars to local nonprofits We created the Loving Room Fund so our agents can easily and effortlessly give back to their community United in our efforts we know we can do more to affect change and have a greater impact on the world around us The success of our business is deeply rooted in our commitment to developing vibrant communities Our agents donate a percentage of every commission to one of the nonprofits we chose collectively We’re currently partnering with the African American Alliance for Homeownership Hoffman Center for the Arts Rose Haven and Taking Ownership PDX AAAH provides housing counseling and homeowner assistance programs to African Americans and

protecting over  acres of wildlands in and around Oregon’s only national park – Crater Lake – as Wilderness They’ve also been a strong advocate for Oregon’s native wildlife such as wolverine salmon sea otters and gray wolves Urban Gleaners rescues edible surplus food that would otherwise be thrown away from grocery stores restaurants event sites farms and farmers markets They collect roughly 50 pounds of food each month and deliver it free of charge to hungry children and their families through their Food to Schools program here in PortlandTheir mission is to reduce waste and want simultaneously It has been a great year and I have met many new colleagues and clients who have become friends I am so grateful to the fabulous folks I have had the pleasure of working with this past year Thank you for your support and your votes for me to receive the Five Star Professional Award for the 8th time-WOW- this means so much to me Here is the link to participate in their program  There are many

missions of all the organizations we were blessed to hear from If any of these stories resonate with you I urge you to donate whether money or time to help them continue the beneficial work they do within our community Greater Than – The mission of Greater Than is to support and empower students from poverty- impacted communities to thrive in school college and career To that end we identify and convene quality best-in-class partners based on track record evidence of impact and recruit them to join our collaborative whole school model on their own dime Our programs focus on students and families from Oregon’s most poverty-impacted communities promote culturally responsive family engagement We work closely with parents who are the primary drivers of program priorities are long-term—we work with students and their families from Pre-K through college and career and are inclusive—we do not “cherry pick” students and are deeply committed to educational equity Harper’s Playground – Our

same playground in our neighborhood Impact NW – Impact NW is a premier provider of educational and social services in the greater Portland metro area Our mission is to help people prosper through a community of support Impact NW is a private non-profit organization that began in  as Portland Action Committees Together Inc PACT Four neighborhoods came together and created the agency to address the growing problems associated with poverty in the area Since our inception Impact NW has been a leader in providing individuals of all ages with the skills and resources necessary to achieve success and to advocate for themselves and their communities Annually over 30 low-income children youth families seniors and adults with disabilities participate in Impact NW’s comprehensive anti- poverty programs Oregon Wild – Founded in  Oregon Wild formerly the Oregon Natural Resources Council or ONRC has been instrumental in securing permanent legislative protection for some of Oregon’s most precious

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Based on the provided information, there doesn't seem to be any specific joint events, projects, or initiatives mentioned between Jenelle's real estate agency and other entities. However, there are instances where individuals from these different groups collaborate or participate together. For example, Jenelle matches and donates a portion of her marketing budget to various organizations working towards ending racism, providing access to housing, promoting human rights, and preserving civil liberties. Additionally, Jenelle's agency partners with local non-profit organizations like African American Alliance for Homeownership (AAAH), Hoffman Center for the Arts, Rose Haven, and Taking Ownership PDX. These partnerships involve collaboration and shared goals, even though they might not be specifically labeled as "joint events" or "initiatives."

source.content: Full transparency I was a community organizer before I was a real estate agent and damn if I’m not grateful for that perspective Community Organizer to Real Estate Agent during a Global Pandemic During an Uprising What a twist I love to organize behind the scenes strategy based Some have reached out and wondered What can they actually do I don’t know baby but it better be something and quick If you didn’t already know me my politics are VERY BEYONCE To the left to the left But you’re in luck This will not be a linguistically dense judgey guilt invoking pointing of the finger kinda list Just some things I’m thinking about or doing Things you may be thinking about doing or want to consider doing too To be fair I’m clear that we currently all live in contradiction Real Estate and Capitalism will continue on for the foreseeable future We need a cell phone and computer to do our jobs Clothes to leave the house cars to take us there And while we all have variations of what we chose to

Jenelle is joined by Department of Community founder Rosemary Brensen as they chat about her journey from design school to running the Portland Garment Factory to founding the Department of Community We hear from Rosemary about… – Coaching entrepreneurs on building systems to help them achieve work life balance – Having a cohort of trusted people  building networks of support       Listen on whatever platform you get your podcasts or click below At the age of 48 there are a couple of things that I’m proficient or good This past month I got to be the client I couldn’t be more thrilled to move In a move that has both impressed and bewildered local educators Steve Brian a neighborhood dad While there is much to be celebrated within the queer community there is also much to We love to talk share and be friendly Connect with us on social media

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objective and outcome expected from these collaborations involve providing exceptional service to clients while guiding them towards achieving their real estate goals. Both Aryne and Dulcinea aim to build strong relationships based on trust, communication, and understanding of each client's unique needs. Through their expertise, investigative skills, and knowledge of the local market, they work together to identify suitable properties and negotiate favorable terms for their clients. Ultimately, the desired outcome is to successfully help clients invest in their futures by finding the perfect property or making informed decisions about selling or renting their current home.

source.content: collaboration to guide you in investing in your future and reaching you real estate goals Aryne greets working with clients throughout Portland with open arms Licensed since  she appreciates the ever shifting desires her clients have as they move through their real estate goals Investigative genius on her side Aryne will strive to bring you the results you desire  When not working for you Aryne is a constant cheerleader for her son and daughter’s pursuits on the basketball court and on the ballet stage She practices yoga hikes loves to walk and explore Portland neighborhoods reads and delights in soaking up everything Portland has to offer  Dulcinea thrives on working with clients with a range of real estate goals  Oregon born with a design and an award-winning professional background Dulcinea is steadfast when it comes to working for her clients and has a keen eye for properties that best serve client objectives Licensed since  Dulcinea works in and around Portland  A mother of two
